li: Get valid certificates. Provision valid certificates for the server hosting the Web Services.

Set up SSL/TLS on the server. Configure the server to use SSL/TLS for the Web Services. Don't allow unencrypted connections to the Web Services – don't bind Web Services to ports that don't use SSL/TLS.
Update client code to use SSL/TLS. Change client code to connect to the Web Services using the port that uses SSL/TLS.
p: Use SSL/TLS to protect Web Service connections.
Protect Web Service connections using SSL/TLS to prevent man-in-the-middle attacks.
To use SSL/TLS to protect Web Service connections:
ol:
Get valid certificates. Provision valid certificates for the server hosting the Web Services.
 Set up SSL/TLS on the server. Configure the server to use SSL/TLS for the Web Services. Don't allow unencrypted connections to the Web Services – don't bind Web Services to ports that don't use SSL/TLS.
 Update client code to use SSL/TLS. Change client code to connect to the Web Services using the port that uses SSL/TLS.
strong: Set up SSL/TLS on the server.
Update client code to use SSL/TLS.

html:
Applies To

  • PHP

What to Do

Use SSL/TLS to protect Web Service connections.

Why

Protect Web Service connections using SSL/TLS to prevent man-in-the-middle attacks.

How

To use SSL/TLS to protect Web Service connections:

  1. Get valid certificates. Provision valid certificates for the server hosting the Web Services.
  2. Set up SSL/TLS on the server. Configure the server to use SSL/TLS for the Web Services. Don't allow unencrypted connections to the Web Services – don't bind Web Services to ports that don't use SSL/TLS.
  3. Update client code to use SSL/TLS. Change client code to connect to the Web Services using the port that uses SSL/TLS.
